Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.util

Class ListUtil

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.util.ListUtil
public class ListUtil
extends Object
Helper utility class for lists that contains only static methods to call them directly like:

ListUtil.asString(new ArrayList(...), ";");
Author:
LK Test Solutions

  • Constructor Details

    • ListUtil

      public ListUtil()

  • Method Details

    • asString

      public static String asString​(List<?> list, String separator)
      Transform a list of generic type to a separated string. If an object of the list cannot be transformed to a string, the hash code gets added to the returning string.
      Parameters:
      list - A list of generic type like integer or string.
      separator - The separator like semicolon.
      Returns:
      A string containing all the values of the committed list separated by the committed separator.

    • asString

      public static String asString​(String[] values, String separator)
      Append an array of strings to one string with the defined separator.
      Parameters:
      values - The array content.
      separator - The separator for the values.
      Returns:
      the concatenated string or an empty string if the values are empty.

    • asString

      public static String asString​(String[] values, String separator, boolean strip)
      Append an array of strings to one string with the defined separator.
      Parameters:
      values - The array content.
      separator - The separator for the values.
      strip - Removes starting and ending white space from each value if set to true.
      Returns:
      the concatenated string or an empty string if the values are empty.

    • asStringArr

      public static String[] asStringArr​(Object[] arr)
      Transform an array of objects to to list of type string by using the valueOf method of the String class.
      Parameters:
      arr - The object array to transform
      Returns:
      An array of type string with all the elements of the objects array, represented as string.

    • asList

      public static List<String> asList​(List<?> list)
      Transform a list of unknown to to list of type string by using the valueOf method of the String class.
      Parameters:
      list - The object list to transform
      Returns:
      A list of type string with all the elements of the objects list, represented as string.

    • asList

      public static List<String> asList​(String text, String separator)
      Transform a input string to a list of string by splitting it with the committed separator.
      Parameters:
      text - The committed string to transform as list.
      separator - The separator to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of type string with the split values or null if the split is not possible because the string does not contain the separator at least one time.

    • asList

      public static List<String> asList​(String[] arr)
      Add all elements of a string array to a string list return it.
      Parameters:
      arr - The input string array.
      Returns:
      The resulting list of type string.

    • removeSpaceElements

      public static List<String> removeSpaceElements​(List<String> list)
      Remove all elements from a list that contain only spaces.
      Parameters:
      list - A list of type string.
      Returns:
      A list of type string without space elements.

    • getDuplicate

      public static <T> List<T> getDuplicate​(Collection<T> list)
      Get a list with all duplicate values of the committed collection. This works like this: Add all elements of the committed collection to a set that cannot have duplicate values. When an item gets added the overridden add() method of the set gets called that adds the value to the returning list only if it is duplicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The placeholder for every type of collection.
      Parameters:
      list - The collection of any type.
      Returns:
      A list with all duplicate values.

    • getNonDuplicate

      public static <T> List<T> getNonDuplicate​(Collection<T> list)
      Get a list with all non duplicate values of the committed collection. This works like this: Add all elements of the committed collection to a set that cannot have duplicate values. When an item gets added the overridden add() method of the set gets called that adds the value to the returning list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The placeholder for every type of collection.
      Parameters:
      list - The collection of any type.
      Returns:
      A list with no duplicate values.

    • hasDuplicate

      public static <T> boolean hasDuplicate​(Collection<T> list)
      Check if a committed collection has duplicates.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The placeholder for every type of collection.
      Parameters:
      list - The collection of any type.
      Returns:
      True: There are duplicates. False: There are NO duplcates.

    • sortByInteger

      public static List<Integer> sortByInteger​(List<?> list)
      Sort a list of any type by integer using the Collections.sort() method.
      Parameters:
      list - A list of any type.
      Returns:
      The list of type integer sorted by integer from lowest to highest value.

    • asIntList

      public static List<Integer> asIntList​(List<?> list)
      Transform a list of any type to a list of integer values. If a list value cannot be casted to string to parse the value as integer afterwards, the value gets NaN(Not a number). If the list value could be casted to string but not parsed as integer, the value gets NaN as well.
      Parameters:
      list - The input list of any type.
      Returns:
      A list of integer.

    • asStringList

      public static List<String> asStringList​(List<?> list)
      Transform a list of any type to a list of string values. If a list value cannot be parsed as string, null gets added to the returning list.
      Parameters:
      list - The input list of any type.
      Returns:
      A list of strings.
